messages.title: Working hard for our community
messages.content: Since November, the Labour-led council has put in place a new landscaping contractor to tackle the backlog, and we're seeing results. Some areas of Bradwell are in need of more work, such as... but also... and I'm passionate about improving the eye and places to play, and residents can take pride in their estates again. I secured a pilot scheme in Heelands to get the work done and the results are fantastic! Some might consider landscaping maintenance a small thing, but I've learned that even the small work makes a huge difference to people's lives. And the work doesn't stop here.

messages.title: Rachel Pallett says...
messages.content: What I love most about being a councillor is speaking with residents, to hear their concerns and work towards a solution together. My commitment to local residents is to... I'm proud of the council's brilliant work and determined to keep going. Whether it's dealing with complaints about rubbish collection, buses running late, or road safety. As a councillor, I've campaigned to stop HGV traffic through Bradwell and improve our roads.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Pushed for the introduction of a new landscaping contractor to address backlogs and improve the local environment.
Campaigned to stop HGV traffic through Bradwell to improve roadway safety.

housing.content: I've supported residents in Two Mile Ash opposed to the TMA school becoming an academy; I'm against the downsizing of wardens from sheltered accommodation and I oppose building on parkland reserved for residents in Heelands.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured a pilot scheme in Heelands for landscaping work, campaigned against HGV traffic, and supported residents' opposition to local changes.

images.caption: Rachel Pallett pictured with Emily Darlington, Parliamentary Candidate.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet mentions collaborative work with the Labour council and emphasizes local issues such as parkland preservation, oppostion to the academy move, and downsizing of wardens from sheltered accommodation, but it does not provide specific details on the candidate's personal statement, political experience duration, contact information, endorsements, or quotes.
